intro: Rubus hallieri, commonly known as the Halli’s blackberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia, particularly China and Korea. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically dark purple to black in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, with a serrated edge, and it has thorny stems typical of many Rubus species. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soil.
